name: Desktop Pendulum Wave
description: This desktop pendulam wave combines science and mathmatics to create a set of pendulums that swing in a repeating pattern. Pendulums are governed by the principals of physics and swing in a predictable manner based on their physical characteristics.

name: Ferrofluid Fun
description: Ferrofluid is a liquid that posseses the characteristics of a magnet. In this exhibit, you can use magnets to create shapes in the container of ferrofluid using the liqueds magnetic properties.

name: Face Swap
description: This is exhibit lets you combine your face with a friends. Using mirrors, you'll be able to see the reflection of your face in front of your partners face.

name: Levitation Station
description: This exhibit uses magnets to allow a car to float above a track. This exhibit lets you race with a partner and see who's levitating car can make it to the end of their track faster.

name: Center of Attraction
description: Using magnets and magnetic black sand, this exhibit demonstrates the science behind magnets and magnetic poles, which is evident in how the sand spikes up when interacting with a magnet.

name: The Way the Ball Bounces
description: This exhibit demonstrates how gravity affects a ball as it falls downward through a set of wooden pegs.

name: Pattern Maker
description: While making patterns in the spinning sand, this exhibit allows you to observe the effects of centrifugal force and the Coriolis Effect. These two invisible forces result in curved lines when you draw in the sand.

name: Off to the Races
description: In this exhibit, two partners race ping pong balls down a peg board. This exhibit combines science and mathmatics, the ball is brought down the board by gravity while predicting what path the ball takes comes down to mathmatic probability.

name: Balance That
description: This exihibit demonstrates the effects of weight distribution and counterbalances as you attempt to balance an array of items on the designated disc.

name: Parachute Launcher
description: This exhibit demonstrates the concepts of aerodynamics, velocity, and surface area by utilizing a wind tunnel to test the flight of various objects.
